title: How many commas are needed in this sentence? - Quora

response.answer_text: No matter how many commas are in that sentence, it's still awkward. I'd rephrase it: Habicht fell into disgrace, never to regain his former position. He died in combat in 1944.

1.  Comma is needed to separate  a defining ,or restrictive , relative clause from its antecedent as done in the sentence is correct. Use of comma in the above sentence is in order. 2. Comma between "disgrace"and "never" is not needed.
